quote: Captain, Doctor, I am honored by   your presence, but may I suggest   you attend the second concert.
Why, Data?
Ensign Ortiz will perform the   violin part. My rendition will   be less enjoyable.
Oh?
While I am quite proficient   Technically, according to my   fellow performers, I lack soul.
Data, telling us why you're going   to fail before you make the   attempt is never wise.
But is not honesty always the   preferred choice?
Excessive honesty can be   disastrous... particularly in a   commander.
Indeed?
Knowing your limitations is one   thing. Advertising them to a crew   can damage your ability to lead.
Because you lose their respect?
No, because you may begin to   believe in those limitations   yourself.
Captain, we're receiving a message   from the Sheliak Corporate.
Origin point of the message   confirmed. It is from the Shelia   star system.
The Sheliak have not attempted   to communicate with the Federation   for a hundred and eleven years.
On screen.

Federation creatures, there are   humans on the fifth planet of Tau   Cygna. This planet was ceded   to the corporate in section one   hundred and thirty-three,   paragraph seventy-seven of the   Treaty of Armens. We will begin   settlement of this world in four   days. Remove the humans.
What the devil --
Federation creatures, there are   humans on the fifth planet --
Cancel message.
Tau Cygna Five is in the de Laure   belt -- heavy concentrations of   hyperonic radiation.
Humans can't survive in such an   environment. Exposure to   hyperonic radiation is fatal.
Then the Sheliak are asking us   to chase ghosts.
No, Number One. The Sheliak   haven't broken a century of   silence to send us after phantoms.   An investigation is in order.   Set course for Tau Cygna Five.
Human life form readings from the   planet.
So, the Sheliak weren't   hallucinating.
Numbers?
Impossible to get an accurate   reading, Captain. The high   radiation levels are disrupting   our sensors.
Hyperonic radiation also   interferes with ship's   transporters; they are now   inoperable.
So are the ship's phasers.
How can humans survive down there?

They must have found a way to   adapt.       Milan's work in radiation   sensitivity suggests it's   possible. Perhaps with extensive   virotherapy...       Until they found the answer, their   mortality rate must have been   staggering.
Well, whoever they are and however   they've survived, we've got to   get them off the planet.
By treaty, this world does belong   to the Sheliak...
... who are within their rights   to demand the removal of these   "trespassers."
And if we don't remove them, the   Sheliak will.
How forcefully?
To the Sheliak, humans are a lower   life form. They'd have no   compunctions about exterminating   the intruders.
Mister Data. As you are unaffected   by hyperonic radiation, you will   go to the planet via shuttlecraft   and commence evacuation   procedures.
Aye, sir.
Any speculation as to what he'll   find, Number One?
A lost survey ship would be my   guess. A dozen or so survivors   at most.
A shuttlecraft!
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Where's it from?
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Look at the markings. I think   it's from the Federation.
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Hello.
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: We saw your ship... You're the   first visitor we've had in...
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: The first visitor we've ever had.
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: You're -- not human.
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: That is correct. I am an android.   I am Lieutenant Commander Data   of the Federation Starship   Enterprise.
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Our great-grandparents were   citizens of the Federation.       But you don't want to waste time   talking to us...
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: You'll want to speak with   Gosheven. We'll take you to him.
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Excellent.
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: I'm sure the Federation will be   very proud of us. Wait until you   see all we've accomplished.
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: And who, precisely, is "we?"
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: You don't know? No, I guess you   wouldn't, would you? We are the   descendants of the original   settlers -- from the colony ship   Artemis.
scene: 7    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Got it. The Artemis, launched one   hundred forty-two years ago,   destination Septimis Minor. When   they failed to check in, Starfleet   began an extensive search.
What carried the Artemis so far   off course?
My local informant does not know.   In the early days survival on Tau   Cygna Five was more important than   history.
scene: 9    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Understood. How many are there?
scene: 9    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Approximately fifteen thousand.
scene: 9    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: We've only got three days.   Without working transporters, we   couldn't have them out in time.
scene: 9    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Shuttles?
scene: 9    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Loading all the Enterprise   shuttlecraft to capacity --   evacuation would take four weeks,   four days.
scene: 9    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Then we need more time. Mister   Data, prepare the colonists for   an evacuation.
scene: 9    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Aye, sir.
scene: 9    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Mister Worf, get me the Sheliak.
scene: 9    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Their home world is quite distant,   Captain. This will take some   time.
scene: 9    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Gosheven, look what's come --
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Lieutenant Commander Data of the   Starship Enterprise.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: He's an android.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: So he is.       Well, you're here -- what do you   want?
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: My mission is to prepare this   colony for evacuation.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Why?
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Because this planet belongs to   the Sheliak.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: And just who is this Sheliak?
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: The term is plural. The Sheliak   are an intelligent, non-humanoid   life form, classification R-3 --
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: This colony's been here for a   hundred and forty years -- and   no one's ever seen a Sheliak.   I'd say that makes Tau Cygna   Five our planet. (ALTERNATE:   ninety years)
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: But the original destination of   the Artemis was Septimis Minor.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: The guidance systems on the   Artemis failed -- and sent them   off course. Far off course.   Our ancestors were lucky to find   any place to land.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: And when they did, the radiation   started killing them.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Hyperonic radiation took the lives   of a third of the colonists before   they learned they could adapt   to it.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: But the colony survived -- and   prospered.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Look around. We've brought   water to the desert, built a   community.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Your accomplishments are indeed   remarkable. However, the   Sheliak and the Federation   have a treaty that clearly makes   this planet Sheliak domain.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Then change the treaty.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: That may not be possible. The   Sheliak wish to colonize this   planet, and they are unwilling   to share it with humans.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: If you are still here when the   Sheliak colony ship arrives,   they will eradicate you.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: They would kill us all?
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: They have little regard for   human life. Thus, our most   sensible course is to prepare a   contingency plan for the   evacuation of your people.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: We're not evacuating.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Perhaps I have not made myself   clear.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Yes, you have. Now let me be   equally clear. There's going   to be no evacuation.       You've delivered your message --   so go back to your ship. I have   work to do.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Nice catch. Wonderful reflexes.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Sorry to test you like that --   but I was curious.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Found a new toy, have we, Ardy?
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Toy? This is the most incredible   android I've ever seen.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Have you seen many?
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Actually, no. You're the first.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Only you would get this excited   over a walking calculator.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: He's more interesting than   anything else walking around   here...
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Depends on what you find   interesting.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Cybernetic intelligence fascinates   me. Are your neural pathways   duotronic?
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: No -- they are positronic.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I didn't know that was possible!   What's your memory capacity? How   many operations per second? I   have a million questions...
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I am afraid I have no time to   answer one million questions.   I have a mission to accomplish.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I need to know more about your   people, and Gosheven seems   unwilling to talk to me further.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I'm Ard'rian McKenzie. Perhaps   I can help you.
scene: 11   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Gentlemen, we're giving you an   assignment, and the one thing we   don't want to hear is that it is   impossible.
I need the transporters to   function despite the hyperonic   radiation.
Impossi -- Yes, sir.
Even if we can get the Sheliak   to talk to us, they're not likely   to be accommodating.
Captain, when the treaty was   negotiated the Federation sent   three hundred and seventy-two   legal experts. What have we got?
Thee... and me.
No response.
Try again. Boost signal strength.
Sheliak Corporate. This is the   Starship Enterprise. Respond   please.
Conversation is neither required   nor desired.
Conversation is necessary if we   are to find a solution to our   mutual problem.
Our involvement in Federation   illegality is not indicated.
Both parties are involved, sir.
Remove the humans from the Tau   Cygna system. Three Earth days   remain.
Their culture is extremely formal,   almost ritualistic. An apology   might smooth matters.
I apologize for our inadvertent   violation of the treaty.
Acknowledged and accepted. Now   remove the human creatures.
Let us negotiate in good faith...
Negotiate to what purpose? The   treaty is signed.
There is a thriving colony on the   planet. Rather than uproot these   people may I offer a compromise?
Denied.
Why?!
The law is paramount. We are   entitled.
This is not a law. It is a   treaty. It is designed to smooth   relations between peoples. Not   to act as a strait...
... jacket.
... you really think we'll have   to leave Tau Cygna Five?
The possibility exists, and   Gosheven appears unwilling to   prepare for it. Why?
Maybe because you're an   android. I don't think Gosheven   likes the idea of machines   ordering him around.
I am not ordering him to do   anything; I am merely trying to   persuade him that his people   should prepare to evacuate.       Do you believe my suggested   course of action should be followed?
Of course.
In spite of the fact that I am   an android?
Because of that fact. I don't   have any silly prejudices against   computers -- I like them.
Not that any computer we have is   half as sophisticated as you...
No, I would say not.
People can be selfish,   irrational, stubborn, malicious   -- you name it. But computers   don't have those failings.
You conclude from this that I am   impartial... hence you accept   my recommendations.
Yet Gosheven does not.       Perhaps he might reconsider his   position if someone other than   myself were to present the   arguments.
Well, I'm willing to talk to him,   but I don't think he'll take me   seriously.       He finds me attractive -- but I'm   not interested in him at all.   So he belittles me to protect his   ego --
Data, here.
The Sheliak won't bargain.
Understood.
I'm contacting Starfleet to   arrange for transport. Get those   people prepared for evacuation.   We may have to move very quickly.
Yes, sir.
We must speak with Gosheven   immediately.
Gentlemen, how are you coming?       What the hell is that?
Our first attempt.
We recalibrated the transporter   setting for the tightest possible   beam.
But we've got plenty of things   left to try.
There's some really interesting   residue . . . reminds me of --       There's that damn pulsar in the   neighborhood.
Teremi-thorons.
This just got a lot harder.
They're one of the most elusive   sub-atomic particles known, and   they really shred a transporter   signal.
Thank you, Ensign, I passed   physics.       Keep at it. We need those   transporters.
We're going to have a lot of fun   cracking this one.
See that? Do you have any idea   what it is? What it means?
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: It is water, a substance composed   of two atoms of hydrogen --
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: It's not water. It's blood and   sweat -- the result of a hundred   and forty years of combined   effort. (ALTERNATE: ninety   years) This isn't a town.
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: It's a monument to every man,   woman, and child who has lived   and died on Tau Cygna Five.
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Gosheven, you're talking nonsense.
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Am I? My grandfather's buried   on that mountain.    (points to the distant     line of hills)   He died in a rock slide surveying   the route for this aqueduct. This   colony exists because of his   sacrifice, and the sacrifices of   thousands of others. No, we're   not leaving.
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: The Sheliak will not accept humans   on their planet. And they will   not hesitate to use force to   remove you.
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: And we will not hesitate to fight   back.
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: You cannot win.
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: You just don't understand, do you?   We will not be bullied off our   land... not by you, and not by   the Sheliak.
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Stubborn and irrational. Now what   do we do?
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Are his sentiments typical among   the colonists?
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I hope not. Are you thinking   of bypassing Gosheven and taking   your case directly to the people?
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I see no other course of action.   If I can convince enough people   of the necessity of leaving --
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Don't you mean "if we can   convince?"
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: You are offering assistance?
scene: 22   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Yes, sir?
Three weeks. Starfleet is profuse   in their apologies, but it will   still be three weeks.
Until?
Until the arrival of a colony   transport ship equipped with   dedicated personnel shuttles.
We can't wait three weeks.
The Sheliak must agree to extend   our deadline.
If they plan to settle Tau Cygna   Five two days from now...
... one of their ships must already   be en route.
We're going to intercept that   ship.
The Sheliak may interpret that   as a hostile act.
We have to take the risk.
The Enterprise is going to try   to intercept the Sheliak colony   ship. Your job ... well, you know   your job.

Commander, in human parlance, I do   not believe I can "get the job   done." My training has prepared   me for starship command duties.   As a cultural contact I am   proving to be less than exemplary.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: What's the situation?
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Their leader has rejected my   counsel. He denies the logic of   my arguments and talks of   structures they have built.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Then try something else.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I have. In the last three hours   and eight minutes, I have spoken   to fifty-six colonists. Ten   refused to believe a threat   exists. Twenty-two favored   staying and fighting the Sheliak.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I don't have time for this.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Sixteen preferred negotiation or   some form of passive resistance.   Only eight were willing to   consider evacuation. And of those   eight --
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Data, I can't help you -- I don't   know these people; I haven't   talked to them. You have. Use   that fancy positronic brain of   yours -- and carry out your   mission.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: If I do not succeed, how violent   is the Sheliak reaction likely   to be?
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: The treaty is the only thing which   kept them from eradicating the   colony the moment they discovered   it.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Ah.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: "Ah" is right. The lives of   fifteen thousand people are riding   on you. You'd better get   innovative. Riker out.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Data -- we're having an effect.   So many people are asking   questions about the Sheliak that   Gosheven's called a public   meeting.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Is there any indication that   Gosheven has changed his position?
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: No. But a meeting will give you   the chance to present your   recommendations.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: First, will Gosheven allow me to   speak? Second, even if he does,   what good will it do? So far,   my attempts at persuasion have   been ineffective.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Why did you do that?
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: You appeared to need it.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Among humans, a kiss normally   serves to seal a friendship or   to indicate support, attraction,   affection.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: In this context, I would assume   your intention was to express   support.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: That was my primary motivation.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: You don't really understand human   behavior, do you?
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: That is something of an   understatement.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Sometimes I don't either.   androids are a lot more rational.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Thus far, that quality has not   helped me accomplish my mission.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: A rational argument isn't always   enough. Maybe to be more   persuasive, you need to use a   little reverse psychology.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Elicit a desired behavior by   advocating its opposite?       That implies deception, does it   not?
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: A little. But if it helps us   get our point across...
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Perhaps this is a situation in   which excessive honesty is   detrimental.
scene: 24   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: How are we progressing, Mister   La Forge?
About like you'd expect.
Splendid.
He wants the impossible.
That's the short definition for   "captain."
You've all heard about the android   Starfleet sent here, and you've   been discussing why he's come.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I called this meeting to replace   misinformation with cold, hard   fact.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Leave. Immediately.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I wish to speak.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: No.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: (loud, for the crowd's     benefit)   You deny me the opportunity to   address the assemblage?
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: This meeting is not for outsiders.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Do you consider your position so   weak that it cannot withstand   debate?
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Let him talk.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: You know of the Sheliak threat.   Starfleet wishes to evacuate you   for your own protection.   Gosheven has decided otherwise.   That is his right. And I will   not waste time trying to reverse   that decision.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I admire your conviction in the   face of certain defeat. Your   effort will be valiant, though   doomed. Still, when you die,   you will die for land and honor.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Your children will understand that   they are dying for a worthy cause.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Long after the battle is over,   their courage will be remembered   and extolled.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Remembered by who?
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: (as if he hadn't     considered that)   Ah, that is true. There will be   no one left alive to remember.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: A valiant try, android, but what   a low opinion you must have of   us.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I was simply attempting to   describe your inevitable   destruction in a manner that   would have an emotional effect.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: And he did it pretty damned well.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Are you ready to follow this   machine, Haritath? Give up   everything? Without a fight?   He says we're going to lose, I   think that's his own cowardice   talking!
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: And what if he's right, and you're   wrong? Shouldn't we consider that   possibility?
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: We may be sacrificing ourselves   for nothing --
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Last winter we buried your little   girl -- laid her to rest next to   your mother, and you dare speak   of sacrifice?
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: And you, Kentor, we built you   a new house after the fire wiped   you out. Can you simply walk away   from that?
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Better to walk away than to be   annihilated.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: This colony exists because   generations gave their lives for   it. Many people died before we   found a way to adapt to the   radiation. Many more died   bringing water to the desert.   My father --
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: -- is buried on that mountain.   Well, who's going to be left to   bury you?
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Have you considered what this   evacuation means? Everything we   have, we abandon. Everything   we've built turns into dust.   Everything we've accomplished   means nothing.       Well, I say NO! You elected me   to be your leader -- follow me   now! I don't think our chances   are as hopeless as he says. And   I'm willing to stake our lives   on it. Any objections?
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Good, because here... we...   stand.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Then here you die.
scene: 28   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Maybe if we bypassed the autosequence   and decompiled the   pattern buffer... ?
It's no crazier than anything   else we've tried.
Ensign Crusher.
Yes, sir.
If you ever touch my transporter   again... I'll kill you.
Sorry, sir.
Mister Data -- I want to tell you   that... well, Gosheven doesn't   speak for all of us.
scene: 33A  EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I see no point in dying   needlessly.
scene: 33A  EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: And you, Kentor?
scene: 33A  EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: I'm not sure. Gosheven has done   well for us. But I'd like to hear   more of what you have to say.
scene: 33A  EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: There are many others that feel   the same way but are uneasy about   confronting Gosheven.
scene: 33A  EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: Get them together. We'll meet   at my house.
scene: 33A  EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY

quote: In our dealings with other   non-humanoid races there has been   some point of reference; not so   with the Sheliak.
We must have something in common.   We communicate.
Barely. The Sheliak have learned   several Federation languages, but   theirs continues to elude us.
Telepaths?
Attempted and failed.
This is ludicrous!
No, sir, the fact that any alien   race communicates with another   is quite remarkable.
We are stranded on a planet. No   language in common, but I want   to teach you mine.
S'smarith. What did I just say?
Cup? Glass?
Are you sure? I might have meant   liquid, clear, brown, hot. And   we conceptualize the universe in   relatively the same way.
Point taken.

During your talks you must be   extremely accurate. The treaty   is 500,000 words. The length was   to accommodate the Sheliak. They   consider our language irrational,   and demanded this level of   complexity to avoid any future   misunderstandings.
Captain, we have the vessel   carrying the Sheliak colonists   on visual.
On my way.       So it begins.
Open hailing frequencies. This   is Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the   Starship Enterprise.
Your purpose, Enterprise?
We desire face-to-face negotiation   to settle the crisis on Tau Cygna   Five.
We are entitled to consultation   under paragraph five hundred and   sixty-three subparagraph nine.
Granted.
Was that an invitation?
I'm going to take it as such.   Number One, you have the bridge.
Helm, maintain relative position.   Mister Worf, have Transporter Room   Two stand by.
Aye, sir.
... and once the Federation   resettles us, we'll be left   alone?
If you so desire.
We do. We like doing things on   our own.
The Federation will offer as   little or as much help as you   dictate.
Kentor -- are you with us?
Yes.       The question is, how do we   convince Gosheven?
Why do we need to?
Because he's respected. Most   people will do as he says.
The people respect you, too.   If you take a stand, they'll   fall in line.
I don't know. Gosheven's got a   lot of supporters...
Don't forget that, Kentor.
I'm disappointed. I thought we   had settled this.
Apparently, that is not correct.
Still stirring up trouble?
Since when is talk trouble?
It's over. Don't you get it?   You had your say, and you lost.
I appear to be reversing that   defeat.
No, you're not -- you're just   stubborn.       Well, let me tell you something...
... so am I.
Damn you, Gosheven --
You killed him?
I've killed no one.       I've merely shut down a machine.
That's it, everyone. Time to   go home.
You'll see I'm right.
Advance and speak.
Director, we will comply with your   request to remove the colony on   Tau Cygna Five, but we need time.
The given time has elapsed. We   carry the membership and we will   proceed with their debarkation.
The temporary presence of these   humans should not interfere   with your plans.
Unacceptable. You must remove   the creatures.
I'm trying! But the needed ship   won't be available for three   weeks.
Then you are in violation.
I have admitted that! I'm only   asking for a little tolerance.

Section five hundred and one,   paragraph seven hundred and   sixteen, subparagraph five --   unwanted lifeforms inhabiting H   class worlds may be removed at   the discretion of the Sheliak   corporate.
We will remove them. But you   must grant us the time we require.
You need time, Picard of the   Enterprise, we will save you time.   We will eradicate the human   infestation.
They are not vermin! They are   citizens of the Federation and   I will not permit this travesty!
Intelligent converse is   impossible. You do not discuss,   you gibber.
Between intelligent species of   good will --
I take it the Sheliak just hung   up on us. Again.
I was afraid your neural pathways   were scrambled beyond repair.
I am equipped with diagnostic   circuits and can correct many   malfunctions.
I'm not surprised at Gosheven's   behavior. But Kentor and the   others... they said they were   on our side.       I guess words don't mean very   much.
Perhaps that has been part of our   difficulty. Words are all we have   been using.       Humans seem to take much stronger   notice of actions.
I require a phaser.
What's a phaser?
A type of weapon. Unfortunately   it will not function in the   presence of hyperonic radiation.
I will have to be innovative.
Hyperonic radiation randomizes   phaser beams. But I believe I   can improvise a servocircuit which   will compensate by continuously   recollimating the output.
You're using your own neural   subprocessors to build a smarter   phaser.
Essentially correct.
Get word to Gosheven. Tell him   I am coming to the pumping   station. Tell him I am going   to destroy the aqueduct.
He'll try to stop you --
I sincerely hope so.
Go to Yellow Alert. Shields up.
Aye, sir.
Mister Riker, put us nose to nose   with the Sheliak ship. If she   makes a move, match it.
Aye, sir.
Open a hailing frequency.
They're not responding, sir.
They don't have to answer. They   just have to listen! Sheliak   vessel, you will have to go   through me to get at the colony   on Tau Cygna Five!
No response.
Close channel -- and get me that   treaty! They've been beating us   over the head with it for three   days. Let's see if we can't find   something in it that can be   turned to our advantage.
We're going to try to beat them   at their own game?
The treaty is how long?
Five hundred thousand words.
We are going to regret Data's   absence.
That was the "stun" setting.
scene: 48   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: This is not.
scene: 48   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I could reduce this pumping   station to a pile of debris...   but I trust my point is clear.   I am one android with a single   weapon. There are hundreds of   Sheliak on the way... and their   weapons are far more powerful.
scene: 48   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: And the Sheliak may not even offer   you a target. They can obliterate   this colony from orbit. You will   die never having seen the faces   of your killers.
scene: 48   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: The choice is yours.
scene: 48   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: There are other places -- other   challenges. It's time to move   on.
scene: 48   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I really was willing to stay and   die for this.
scene: 48   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I know that, but it is just a   thing, and things can be replaced.   Lives cannot. Live, rebuild and   be remembered.
scene: 48   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - MAIN STREET - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: This is hopeless. Fighting would   be preferable.
That's it.
I don't follow you, sir.
Worf, get me the Sheliak.
(just heard the     reprieve)   Yes, sir!
Pursuant to paragraph one thousand   two hundred and ninety I formally   request third party arbitration   of our dispute.
Agreed.
And further, pursuant to   subsection D, three, I name the   Grizzelas to arbitrate.
Grizzelas?
Grizzelas?
Unfortunately they are currently   in their hibernation cycle, but   they'll awaken in six months, and   then we'll get this matter   settled. Now, do you want to   wait... or give me my three weeks?
Absurd. We carry the membership!   We can brook no delay!
Then I declare the treaty in   abeyance!
Wait! Negotiation is --
You enjoyed that.
You're damn right.
Captain, they are hailing us.
Sir?
On screen.
You may have your three weeks,   Picard of the Enterprise.
(with careful     enunciation)   Thank you.
Captain, we can do it! We can   modify the transporters.
Excellent.
It'll take fifteen years, and a   research team of a hundred --
Mister La Forge, I believe we will   postpone.
Yes, sir.
Commander Data to Enterprise.   I am preparing to leave Tau Cygna   Five and await rendezvous   instructions.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Acknowledged. Stand by.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Hi.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Hello, Ard'rian.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: The evacuation plan is going well.   When the transport ship arrives,   we'll be ready.       You succeeded.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: I would not have succeeded without   your support and insight, and I   appreciate your assistance.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Good. Then you won't forget me?
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: I am incapable of forgetting.   I will remember every detail of   my visit with perfect clarity.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: But nothing more?
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: I do not understand.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: I guess what I really want to know   is -- do you have any feelings   for me?
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: I have no feelings of any kind.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: No. Of course you don't.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: What was that for?
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: You appeared to require it.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: You observed I was unhappy and   did what you concluded would make   me feel better. A purely rational   deduction.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Have I disappointed you?
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: No, I'm disappointed in myself   -- for wanting something I know   I can't have.       Data, in so many ways you're   superior to humans. But you are   still a machine... without   emotion.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Yes.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: It's so easy to believe otherwise.   It's so easy to read things into   your behavior... and perceive   feelings where none exist.       Well, I am human and I do have   feelings... silly though they may   be at times. I like you, Data.   You're my favorite android.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: But I am the only android you have   ever met.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Rational to the last.
scene: 53   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - SHUTTLE LANDING SITE - DAY

quote: Come.
Welcome home, Mister Data. Well   done.
Thank you, sir.
The good doctor was kind enough   to provide me with a recording   of your concert. Your   performance shows a good deal   of feeling.
As I have lately had to remind   others, I have no feelings.
That's hard to believe; your   playing is quite beautiful.
Strictly speaking, it is not   "my" playing. It is a precise   imitation of the techniques of   Jascha Heifetz and Trenka Bron-Ken.
And is there nothing of Data in   what I'm hearing?
You chose the violinists.   Heifetz and Bron-Ken had   radically different styles, but   you combined them -- successfully.
I suppose I have learned to be   innovative... when necessary, sir.
Mister Data... I look forward to   your next concert.
